organization.description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer (FLC) is the nationwide network of federal laboratories that provides the forum to develop strategies and opportunities for linking laboratory mission technologies and expertise with the marketplace.
organization.title: Federal Laboratory Consortium
organization.name: federal-laboratory-consortium

name: integrated-systems-engineering-framework-isef
notes: The ISEF is an integrated SE framework built to create and capture knowledge using a decision-centric method, high-quality data visualizations, intuitive navigation and systems information management. It provides a collaborative environment for all stakeholders, practitioners and leaders to engage in and facilitate decision making based on a mix of qualitative and quantitative inputs. All facets of SE knowledge (requirements, decisions, risks, opportunities and tests) are created, managed and presented in context within a single framework to support Model-Based Systems Engineering information.  Capabilities:  &#8226;&#8194; Technical planning and management &#8226;&#8194; Decision breakdown structure &#8226;&#8194; Trade studies &#8226;&#8194; Requirements to plan traceability &#8226;&#8194; Requirements analysis and decomposition &#8226;&#8194; Operational and functional requirements decomposition &#8226;&#8194; Requirements validation/verification &#8226;&#8194; Portfolio management &#8226;&#8194; Roadmapping - capability, technology and platform &#8226;&#8194; Risk, opportunities and issues management &#8226;&#8194; High-quality visualizations &#8226;&#8194; Evaluation of performance against criteria &#8226;&#8194; Embedded recursive methods for application &#8226;&#8194; Collaboration Web space to connect all stakeholders  Benefits:  &#8226;&#8194; Decision confidence &#8226;&#8194; Accelerated delivery &#8226;&#8194; Requirements compliance &#8226;&#8194; Reduced risk &#8226;Ability to architect for adaptability, commonality and modularity ISEF is an integrated SE knowledge creation and capture framework built on a decision-centric method, high-quality data visualizations, intuitive navigation that enables continuous data traceability, real-time collaboration and knowledge pattern leverage supporting the entire system life cycle.  Project Recon Tool Benefits:  &#8226;&#8194; Promotes collaboration and communication; links risks and issues. &#8226;&#8194; Captures data uniformly. &#8226;&#8194; Provides traceability, historical record and a reference for lessons learned. &#8226;&#8194; Leads to integrated and customizable workflows. &#8226;&#8194; Provides standard and customizable reporting options. &#8226;&#8194; Utilizes secure DoD database/access control - web accessible. &#8226;&#8194; Offers risk, issue and opportunity management tools.
title: Integrated Systems Engineering Framework (ISEF)
